metadata.name: vapour trails #83
metadata.description:
“first you look so strong, then you fade away
the sun will blind my eyes, i’ll love you anyway
thirsty for your smile, i watch you for a while
you are a vapour trail in a deep blue sky”

— Andy Bell (Ride) (1991)

this collection tries to capture that feeling of lying in the grass
in a park
staring at the sky
fantasizing about your love (if they even exist)
playing out different paths
while smoke from your cigarette (jazz or otherwise)
trails between you and the faraway of everything
feeling grateful to not have to be anywhere
but here (now)

with luck
they lay next to you
and silently you appreciate each tick of the clock
wasted together
until life again gets in the way
and pulls you back
into the fray

[ live view commands ]
[ M : toggle matte ]
[ S : save current size ]
[ 1 : save 2000x3000 png ]
[ 2 : save 4000x6000 png ]
[ 3 : save 6000x9000* png ]
[ 4 : save 8000x12000* png ]
[ 5 : save 10000x15000* png ]

* higher resolutions can take a while to render.

twitter: @heyjeres

xoxo

metadata.name: The Matrix #79
metadata.description:
The Matrix is a system, Neo. That system is our enemy. But when you're inside, you look around, what do you see? Businessmen, teachers, lawyers, carpenters. The very minds of the people we are trying to save. But until we do, these people are still a part of that system and that makes them our enemy. 

Can you find the one?


A Matrix homage made with P5.js

attributes.name: Message
attributes.value: Inside the Matrix, they are everyone...and they are no one.

metadata.name: diamond gate #19
metadata.description:
second #gate artwork
The lines create a whole "plan of the city", and then gradually fill it in creating the effect of diamonds. From afar, the artwork looks like computer boards or ancient drawings.

metadata.name: Different Intersections - Iteration 4 #95
metadata.description:
This is the culmination of a series of iterations

____ - Iteration 1
____ - Iteration 2
____ - Iteration 3

The iterations were released under the pseudonym Extracurricular Activities.

The algorithmic theme of the iterations was extensive usage of boolean operations (intersection and difference) on polygons to derive interesting composite shapes.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

metadata.name: Klyft #408
metadata.description:
“Klyft” is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel.

Klyft is a juxtaposition of two different projections for the future. One, made by the World Economic Forum, suggests that the global gender gap will have closed by the year 2154. The other, by the UN IPCC, estimates that global warming will reach 3.2 degrees celcius by the year 2100.

Klyft makes use of the unique temporal aspect of computational art by developing its expression gradually over the next 132 years. As we come closer to 2154, the space between the two shapes in Klyft will grow smaller to symbolize the closing of the gender gap. As time goes on, however, Klyft also becomes more and more glitched out to represent the projected increases in greenhouse gases and climate catastrophes.

In the end, Klyft’s expression will be heavily corrupted, and the two shapes will have reached each other.

· URL parameters ·

You can add the following parameters to the URL to change the behavior of the piece.

date=<YYYY-MM-DD> — See how Klyft looks on another day. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD. 

color=<number> — See the piece in another color scheme. The numbers loop around, so 17 equals 0, 18 equals 1, etc. 

resolution=<number> — View the piece in a higher resolution. 1 is normal resolution, 2 is double, etc. No decimals allowed.

image=true — Save the piece as an image. 

record=true — Save the piece as a video in WEBM format.

Adding the following URL parameters will show Klyft in double resolution on the day gender equality is achieved according to the WEF:

date=2154-01-01&resolution=2

Adding the following URL parameters will save a video of Klyft in the ‘Stokkendahl Dalgas’ color scheme:

color=14&record=true

· Interactions ·

Pressing the following keys will trigger functionality as well as add related URL parameters automatically. 

Pressing D will increment the date by 1 year.

Pressing C will increment the color index by 1.

Pressing R will toggle between normal and double resolution.

Pressing I will toggle the image URL parameter, which saves the piece as an image. Only works outside of iframe.

Pressing V will toggle the video URL parameter, which saves the piece as a video. Only works outside of iframe.

There are secret key presses as well. Some of them only work outside of iframe. 

· Accessibility ·

Klyft is built to support screen readers. It has been tested using MacOS’ VoiceOver, and uses p5.js’ describeElement() to provide screen reader functionality.

If you have any comments (good or bad) on the screen reader integration, don’t hesitate to reach out on my Twitter: @ada_ada_ada_art. 

· Credits and license ·

Klyft is made with p5.js.

Klyft is licensed under a modified version of the Climate Strike License (CSL).

metadata.name: Absorbed #195
metadata.description:
A collaboration between leading British high-end audio brand KEF, generative artist hieroglyphica, and creative studio Parameta, Absorbed embodies the process of noise becoming high-fidelity sound through KEF’s Metamaterial Absorption Technology (MAT™). 

MAT™ makes the KEF sound what it is: absorbing unwanted distortion to deliver pure, accurate sound exactly as the artist intended. Inspired by this intricacy, Absorbed illustrates pseudorandom networks of patterns, slowly emerging and transforming into the maze-like form of MAT™. Clarity is revealed, noise is absorbed – high-fidelity is found.

The noise fields used in Absorbed are of two distinct types: conventional gradient noise and “sinusoidal” noise, an original algorithm developed for this series. The use of animation as artistic medium reflects the artists’ belief that no single frame can capture the full range of complexity found in the tension between sound and noise, and lets collectors observe for themselves this ever-shifting dialogue. A more extensive discussion of the algorithms used in Absorbed can be found in hieroglyphica’s companion article on fx(text).

- spacebar will pause and resume the animation
- s will save a still image of the current frame
- technically minded collectors can consult the index.html file for info on how to render and save high-resolution images
- use of hardware acceleration in Chrome may impact performance

Founded by BBC engineer Raymond Cooke in 1961, KEF is a leading British innovator of high-end audio products including HiFi speakers, subwoofers, architectural speakers, wireless speaker-systems, and headphones. Find out more at kef.com or visit our Discord at discord.com/invite/u48Z9yjY2q.

metadata.name: Landscapes out of my mind #93
metadata.description:
In this work, the third in the series of landscapes, I tried to achieve greater realism without abandoning those elements, also characteristic of the other works, which lead out of reality such as the shapes of the ground and trees and the choice of palettes.

Lands and Clouds are rendered using a mix of simplex noise and FBM (Fractional Brownian Motion), trees are generated with space colonization algorithm an placed using Poisson Disk Sampling distribution. The distribution density is driven by the land heightmap.


Developed with three.js using WebGLRenderer.
Rendering is faster with chrome browser.


[s] to save a png at 2048x1536, 1536x2048, 2048x2048 (4/3, 3/4, 4/4 aspect ratio)
[d] to save a png at 4096x3072, 3072x4096, 4096x4096 (4/3, 3/4, 4/4 aspect ratio)


Features:
"Palette": 14 colormaps
"Aspect Ratio": 4/3, 3/4, 4/4
"View Point":  Far, Medium, Near, Above
"Sky Type": FBM, Gradient1, Gradient2
"Sky Color": LightSkyBlue, Gray, Blue [10% probability]
"Bark Color":  Brown, GrayBrown, Gray
"Bare Trees": True, False


Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Acequia #193
metadata.description:
Acequia (“ah-seh-kee-uh”) - a Spanish adaptation of the Arabic word as-sāqiya, meaning “water carrier”. 

In our second collaboration, Rich and Rick are back with our blend of generative code, intricate design, attention to detail, and a splash of charm. 

 Acequias are traditional irrigation canals used to distribute rainwater and snowmelt along a complex network of narrow channels. They are found in Spain, the American Southwest, and northern Mexico, where they are essential for sustaining fields, orchards, and gardens in semi-arid regions.   
Our aim in this series is to capture the essence of these waterways in bold geometric designs. Each piece is inspired by a mountain village or town in Andalusia (southern Spain). 

The location determines the cube designs and construction rules that are used to build the final output. These are combined with striking day/night palettes, outline styles, scales, climates, and a few surprises of course!


Controls (in live view): 

- Press [p] to pause water animation 
- Press [e] to complete water animation 
- Press [r] to reset water animation 
- Press [s] to save the current image 
- Press [h] for a high-res output suitable for printing 
- Press [b] to toggle the border

metadata.name: Fragments of a Wave #72
metadata.description: Reflective polygons threaded between waves of canvas.

metadata.name: The Plant IV #399
metadata.description: Generative structure by @ge1doot

metadata.name: Out of the Time #8
metadata.description: Generative structure by @ge1doot

metadata.name: Interdimensional Highways I #32
metadata.description:
The pathways between the infinite dimensions are constructed with the beginning of time. Even though a very long time has passed since then, we still cannot travel between dimensions. However, it is prophesied that the barriers to the Interdimensional Highways will soon be opened. Will we be ready for a travel like we've never seen before, by then?

Interdimensional Highways is a two-parts series of generative artwork, showing some of the possible formations of connecting ways between multiple dimensions.

* * *

Press S to save as PNG.

Made by: yenren / twitter.com/yenrenART
Made with: JavaScript + HTML Canvas
License: LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: In the Edge #117
metadata.description:
./ In the Edge

It's been a long time since your journey began, caring for the ones you love, pursuing your dreams, and giving the best of you. 

Now you know you can't go back, you can't go further, you know your time is coming.

How far did you go? It doesn't matter, you did it right. Your accomplishments will serve well the next generations in their journeys, in their search for themselves.

Now it's time to stop, time to take a moment and contemplate the vast universe.

Soon all of this will be ending.

You did it right.

Embrace the void.
=========
=========


./ Color scheme (feature)
There are 12 color schemes and with each set, specific arrays for color collections for the space, stars, planet, and accent colors. 

These are color schemes in the known universe of "In the Edge":
- Mars visions
- Cyberpunk
- Unknown passenger 
- Renegade
- Primary
- Coral
- r.e.d.
- Machines of an ancient-future 
- The void
- Tinted light 
- Malibu dreams
- Atari (horrendous brown, red and yellowish combinations... I love it)

./ Mountain type (feature)
In the Edge, you will find a mountain, and that mountain will be special, which type will you find?

- Parallela insolitum
- Sandy dunes of the truth
- Wavy uncertainty
- Intrinsic soul ridges
- Cerritulus formationis

./ Mountain direction (feature)
Life is about direction... mountains too.

- Left
- Right
- Left-Right

./ Space scenery
This is the spicy touch, some of the iterations will have animation and others will not, giving you a clear view of the magnificent space in front of you.

- Clean (NOT animated)
- Windy planet (animated)
- Topographic planet (animated)
- Meteor shower (animated)

./ Distance from Earth (feature)
How far did you go? Your travel could be from 1 lightyear to 999,999,999 lightyears (that's a lot of lights and years!). However just a few will pass the barrier of 99,999,999ly.

// Additional perks
./ Planet names 
Planet names are unique and they are conformed by three blocks.

The first block is a conjunction between ancient Latin names and Japanese last names. 

The second block takes the last three characters from the fxhash.

The third block takes three numbers from the number seed obtained from fxrand().

The planet you land will be unique, as unique as you are.

// Controls
./ Pause-Play animation
Because maybe (and just maybe) you want to freeze the perfect moment before closing your eyes.

[Backspace] Pause.
[Enter] Play

Applies to "Space scenery" features windy planet, topographic planet, and meteor shower.

metadata.name: Ready for print #49
metadata.description:
S - Save canvas

Vukasin Stancevic  
tw: @lomzart
web: https://www.lomz.net

metadata.name: Stippled Impressions #53
metadata.description:
The grainy texture of stippling has always appealed to me. Charcoal and graphite drawings on rough paper have a similar aesthetic I find appealing. There is something in the rough texture that feels dreamlike.

This project includes the following features: line count, rendering method, interpolation method, line shape, and color palette.

P5.js

metadata.name: Bound #104
metadata.description:
Knots bind and hold, mark time, and unite. But the power of a well-tied knot isn't only to fasten – it also symbolizes how tightly one holds their pledges. Whether a commitment to a partner, community, or oneself – the longevity of a deeply held bond is often marked with a symbol of passing time, like knots tied in a rope.

Let these ropes remind us of the binds we hold – new ones, lengthy ones, unbreakable ones, and even those we’ve had to untie. In plain view, these knots invite us to contemplate what our bonds mean to us, and to see them anew.

---

Press ‘1’-’9’ to increase resolution
Press 's' to save an image of the output at the current resolution

Created with p5.js
For third party license information, please see license.md

---

TENDER x David Brice Allen
July 2022
